sentences.en: Because it can bewitch your quest for remarkable health.
sentences.cn: 因为它可以让你对健康着迷.

sentences.en: Hey, this bewitch person it is a clown really.
sentences.cn: 嘿, 这个蛊惑者真是个小丑.

sentences.en: I can teach you how to bewitch the mind and ensnare the senses.
sentences.cn: 我会教你们如何蛊惑意志,俘获感觉.

sentences.en: Their Name, their Garb, and Work did so intoxicate and bewitch me.
sentences.cn: 他们的名气, 服饰和作品确实使我陶醉,令我着迷.

sentences.en: THERE be none of the affections, which have been noted to bewitch, love envy.
sentences.cn: 世人历来注意到, 所有情感中最令人神魂颠倒着莫过于爱情和嫉妒.

sentences.en: There is none of the affections, which has been noted to fascinate or bewitch, but love and envy.
sentences.cn: 世人历来注意到,所有情感中最令人神魂颠倒著莫过于爱情和嫉妒.

sentences.en: To cast or seem to cast a spell on; bewitch.
sentences.cn: 施以魔法使用或好象使用符咒; 施魔.

words.tran_cn: 迷人的；使人着迷的；使销魂的
蛊惑；使着迷（bewitch的过去式和过去分词）
施魔法于…；使…陶醉；使…着迷（bewitch的ing形式）

trans.tran_en: to make someone feel so interested or attracted that they cannot think clearly

trans.tran_cn: 对（某人）施魔法，令（某人）心醉，入迷
